Package sammish93.tbage.models

Class Item

java.lang.Object
sammish93.tbage.models.Item
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Cloneable, Useable
public class Item extends Object implements Useable, Serializable, Cloneable
A class used to model items that can be stored in a player's inventory, dropped by an enemy, or sold by an ally. Items can be used by a player.
See Also:

  • Method Details

    • create

      public static Item create() throws InvalidValueException
      Returns:
      Returns an initialised Item object with a default UUID value as a name, a default currency value of 0, a 50% probability chance for the item to be dropped on an Enemy being defeated, and an infinite number of uses.
      Throws:
      InvalidValueException - Is thrown if the item drop chance is less than or equal to 0, or greater than 1, or if the currency value or number of uses is a negative integer value.

    • create

      public static Item create(String name) throws InvalidValueException
      Parameters:
      name - A string that is used as an identifier for this item.
      Returns:
      Returns an initialised Item object with a default currency value of 0, a 50% probability chance for the item to be dropped on an Enemy being defeated, and an infinite number of uses.
      Throws:
      InvalidValueException - Is thrown if the item drop chance is less than or equal to 0, or greater than 1, or if the currency value or number of uses is a negative integer value.

    • create

      public static Item create(String name, int value) throws InvalidValueException
      Parameters:
      name - A string that is used as an identifier for this item.
      value - A positive integer value determining the currency value of this item. Used during interaction (trading) with an Ally.
      Returns:
      Returns an initialised Item object with a 50% probability chance for the item to be dropped on an Enemy being defeated, and an infinite number of uses.
      Throws:
      InvalidValueException - Is thrown if the item drop chance is less than or equal to 0, or greater than 1, or if the currency value or number of uses is a negative integer value.

    • create

      public static Item create(String name, int value, double dropChance) throws InvalidValueException
      Parameters:
      name - A string that is used as an identifier for this item.
      value - A positive integer value determining the currency value of this item. Used during interaction (trading) with an Ally.
      dropChance - A decimal value greater than 0 and less than or equal to 1 that determines the chance of an item being dropped upon an Enemy being defeated. NOTE: This value is not a weighted probability (unlike various other probabilities in this framework), and a single enemy can drop multiple items (or no items at all).
      Returns:
      Returns an initialised Item object with an infinite number of uses.
      Throws:
      InvalidValueException - Is thrown if the item drop chance is less than or equal to 0, or greater than 1, or if the currency value or number of uses is a negative integer value.

    • create

      public static Item create(String name, int value, double dropChance, int numberOfUses) throws InvalidValueException
      Parameters:
      name - A string that is used as an identifier for this item.
      value - A positive integer value determining the currency value of this item. Used during interaction (trading) with an Ally.
      dropChance - A decimal value greater than 0 and less than or equal to 1 that determines the chance of an item being dropped upon an Enemy being defeated. NOTE: This value is not a weighted probability (unlike various other probabilities in this framework), and a single enemy can drop multiple items (or no items at all).
      numberOfUses - A positive integer value determining how many times a player can use this item.
      Returns:
      Returns an initialised Item object.
      Throws:
      InvalidValueException - Is thrown if the item drop chance is less than or equal to 0, or greater than 1, or if the currency value or number of uses is a negative integer value.

    • onUse

      public void onUse(GameEngine gameEngine)
      Specified by:
      onUse in interface Useable
      Parameters:
      gameEngine - The current instance of the GameEngine is required so that the lambda used can reference other dependencies of the GameEngine class such as the player or current encounter.

    • isUseable

      public boolean isUseable()
      Returns:
      Returns true in the event that there is an on-use behavior set that can execute when the onUse() method is called.

    • setOnUseBehaviour

      public void setOnUseBehaviour(Useable useable)
      Parameters:
      useable - Intended to use a lambda to allow developers to create custom behaviours when a specific ability is used. Example of a lambda created using the generic Useable interface: Useable onUse = (gameEngine) -> { var player = gameEngine.getPlayer(); player.addToCurrentHealth(5); gameEngine.printMessage("You take a sip of the health potion and recover 5 health!"); };

    • getOnUseBehaviour

      public Useable getOnUseBehaviour()
      Returns:
      Returns the generic Useable interface if it exists.

    • getName

      public String getName()
      Returns:
      Returns a string representing the name of this object. If no name is set then an UUID converted to a string will be returned.

    • setName

      public void setName(String name)
      Parameters:
      name - Sets the name of this object to a new string value.

    • getValue

      public int getValue()
      Returns:
      Returns the currency value of this item.

    • setValue

      public void setValue(int value) throws InvalidValueException
      Parameters:
      value - Sets the currency value of the item. This is used during interaction (trading) with an Ally.
      Throws:
      InvalidValueException - Is thrown in the event that a negative integer value is provided.

    • getDropChance

      public double getDropChance()
      Returns:
      Returns a decimal value of the drop chance of this item upon Enemy being defeated. A value of 0.5 is equivalent to a 50% chance, and a value of 1 is equivalent to a 100% chance. NOTE: This value is not a weighted probability (unlike various other probabilities in this framework), and a single enemy can drop multiple items (or no items at all).

    • setDropChance

      public void setDropChance(double dropChance) throws InvalidValueException
      Parameters:
      dropChance - Sets a positive integer value of the drop chance of this item upon Enemy being defeated. A value of 0.5 is equivalent to a 50% chance, and a value of 1 is equivalent to a 100% chance. NOTE: This value is not a weighted probability (unlike various other probabilities in this framework), and a single enemy can drop multiple items (or no items at all).
      Throws:
      InvalidValueException - Is thrown in the event that a negative integer value is provided.

    • getImagePath

      public String getImagePath()

    • setImagePath

      public void setImagePath(String imagePath)

    • getNumberOfUses

      public int getNumberOfUses()
      Returns:
      Returns the number of uses remaining of this specific item.

    • setNumberOfUses

      public void setNumberOfUses(int numberOfUses) throws InvalidValueException
      Parameters:
      numberOfUses - Sets the number of uses to an integer value greater than or equal to 0. NOTE: If the number of uses is set to 0 then this item will be considered to have infinite number of uses.
      Throws:
      InvalidValueException - Is thrown in the event that a negative integer value is provided.

    • clone

      public Object clone() throws CloneNotSupportedException
      This method is intended to be abe to provide functionality so that a player inventory can include duplicate items, but which can all be used individually.

    • save

      public void save(String path) throws IOException
      Serialises to a local path. The file type extension is '.ser'.
      Parameters:
      path - The location that the .ser file will be saved to, along with the file name. Example: item.save("src/fileName");
      Throws:
      IOException - Arises if the file path cannot be serialised to.
      InvalidPathException - Arises if the path contains characters other than the English alphabet, underscores, and forward slashes.

    • save

      public void save(String path, String fileExtension) throws IOException
      Serialises to a local path. The file type extension is decided by the developer.
      Parameters:
      path - The location that the .ser file will be saved to, along with the file name. Example: item.save("src/fileName", "sav");
      fileExtension - The file type extension the developer wishes to save the file as.
      Throws:
      IOException - Arises if the file path cannot be serialised to.
      InvalidPathException - Arises if the path contains characters other than the English alphabet, underscores, and forward slashes.

    • load

      public static Item load(String path) throws IOException, ClassNotFoundException
      Serialises to a local path. The file type extension is only required when the extension is something other than '.ser'.
      Parameters:
      path - The location that the file is located at. This can either be with or without the file extension. Examples: var item = Item.load("src/fileNameWithSavExtension.sav"); or var item = Item.load("src/fileNameWithSerExtension");
      Throws:
      IOException - Arises if the file path cannot be serialised to.
      ClassNotFoundException - Arises if the file cannot be deserialised to this class. underscores, and forward slashes.
